DataElement.preferredName: Patient Central Nervous System Disease or Disorder Eligibility Determination Ind-3b
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable related to eligibility criteria for person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment having disease related to the brain and spinal cord.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Central Nervous System Disease or Disorder Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to eligibility criteria for person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment having disease related to the brain and spinal cord.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Central Nervous System Disease or Disorder Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: The main information-processing organs of the nervous system, consisting of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a histo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or evidence upon physical examination of CNS disease, including primary brain tumor, seizures not controlled with standard medical therapy, any brain metastases, or history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA, stroke), transient ischemic attack (TIA) or subarachnoid hemorrhage within six months of the first date of treatment on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Known central nervous system or brain metastasis that are either symptomatic or untreated

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or evidence upon physical examination of CNS disease, including brain tumor, seizures not controlled with standard medical therapy or any brain metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Known CNS metastases or seizure disorder

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of active seizures, i.e., seizures within the last 12 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of metastatic CNS disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have seizures or have a history of seizures?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of CNS Disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: AECC Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of brain metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: AECC Text  2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has history of seizure disorder, has patient had a seizure episode within the last 6 months? (N/A only if patient does not have history of seizure disorder)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or evidence upon physical examination of CNS disease, including primary brain tumor, seizures or history of seizures, and/or CNS metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or evidence upon physical examination of CNS disease, including primary brain tumor, seizures not controlled with standard medical therapy, any brain metastases or a history of stroke within 5 years of the first date of treatment on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of recurrent, progressive or refractory central nervous system (CNS) tumor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have DIPG or other centrally confirmed Rb1 positive recurrent, progressive or refractory central nervous system (CNS) tumor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologic verification of a primary CNS tumor at original diagnosis or at relapse? The requirement for histological verification is waived in patients with DIPG (Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Intractable seizures while on adequate anticonvulsant therapy-more than 1 seizure per month for the past 2 months

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC-Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a diagnosis of recurrent or refractory primary CNS malignancy (excluding low-grade gliomas)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have DIPG with atypical presentation on MRI which has been confirmed by biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: For patients with DIPG who have undergone a biopsy, does the patient have a diagnosis of high-grade glioma or diffuse infiltrating glioma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active seizure disorder uncontrolled by medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have asymptomatic untreated CNS disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have asymptomatic untreated or treated CNS disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of intact Rb1 protein from a CLIA certified laboratory?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have asymptomatic untreated CNS metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a recurrent, progressive or refractory primary CNS tumor with evidence of genetic activation of the MET pathway, regardless of histology?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does CNS disease demonstrate evidence of stabilization after the 28 day time point after definitive treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have CNS disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known primary central nervous system (CNS) malignancy or CNS metastasis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed medulloblastoma that is recurrent or progressive?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had prior brain metastases or CNS disease, are the following criteria met: treatment is completed and either (1) has no evidence of active CNS disease for at least 4 weeks prior to the first dose OR (2) has stable CNS lesions, or be at least 2 weeks past radiation or gamma-knife therapy.Â  Patients with past CNS disease must also have a Screening head CT or MRI demonstrating stable disease compared to their most recent CNS evaluation.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have asymptomatic treated CNS disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active seizure disorder uncontrolled by medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of reactivity for B7H3 (CD276) from a CLIA certified laboratory?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an H3K27M positive Thalamic Diffuse Midline Glioma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active seizure disorder uncontrolled by medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a histologically confirmed diagnosis of Medulloblastoma that is recurrent or progressive?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant have a history of stroke, traumatic brain injury, brain surgery, Alzheimer's disease or other dementia?

DataElement.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Assessments Ind-3b 2958018v1 with VD ID#3506036 - Yes No Not Applicable Indicator - dbw
